The Project was designed to enhance ocean management through geospatial data on the full range of significant human uses of the ocean environment from the shorelines of New Hampshire and Southern Maine to the EEZ boundary.  The data were gathered from regional ocean experts and users through participatory GIS methods. For more information on the project scope, background and related data products, please visit http://www.crrc.unh.edu/workshops/ocean_uses/index.html or http://marineprotectedareas.noaa.gov/dataanalysis/mapping_ocean_uses/welcome.html.]]></Abstract>     <KeywordList><Keyword><![CDATA[Oceans, Marine, National, Renewable energy, offshore, NOAA OCM, Uses]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[These layers show general use and dominant use patterns for eight separate industrial/military ocean uses documented as part of the New Hampshire/Southern Maine Ocean Uses Atlas project.  These uses include:  Aquaculture, Military operations, Mining and mineral extraction, Offshore Alternative Energy, Cruise Ships, Offshore Oil and Gas, Shipping, and Underwater cables.  The General Use footprint includes all areas in which the use is known to occur with some regularity, regardless of frequency or intensity.  The Dominant Use areas include areas where the use is most commonly pursued and are defined as areas within the general use footprint that are routinely used by most users most of the time.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS> <EX_GeographicBoundingBox><westBoundLongitude>-70.953664</westBoundLongitude><eastBoundLongitude>-67.469906</eastBoundLongitude><southBoundLatitude>42.817253</southBoundLatitude><northBoundLatitude>43.935719</northBoundLatitude></EX_GeographicBoundingBox> <BoundingBox CRS="CRS:84" minx="-70.953664" miny="42.817253" maxx="-67.469906" maxy="43.935719"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:4326" minx="42.817253" miny="-70.953664" maxx="43.935719" maxy="-67.469906"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:3857" minx="-7898525.792100" miny="5284197.105100" maxx="-7510715.605600" maxy="5455499.906500"/>       <Layer queryable="1">         <Name>1</Name>         <Title><![CDATA[Underwater Cables]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[Underwater cables includes ocean observing and telecommunications; excludes cables associated with utilities and energy transmission, lost fishing gears. The General Use footprint includes all areas in which the use is known to occur with some regularity, regardless of frequency or intensity.  The Dominant Use areas include areas where the use is most commonly pursued and are defined as areas within the general use footprint that are routinely used by most users most of the time. The General Use footprint includes all areas in which the use is known to occur with some regularity, regardless of frequency or intensity. The General Use footprint includes all areas in which the use is known to occur with some regularity, regardless of frequency or intensity.  The Dominant Use areas include areas where the use is most commonly pursued and are defined as areas within the general use footprint that are routinely used by most users most of the time.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS> <EX_GeographicBoundingBox><westBoundLongitude>-70.953664</westBoundLongitude><eastBoundLongitude>-67.469906</eastBoundLongitude><southBoundLatitude>42.817253</southBoundLatitude><northBoundLatitude>43.935719</northBoundLatitude></EX_GeographicBoundingBox> <BoundingBox CRS="CRS:84" minx="-70.953664" miny="42.817253" maxx="-67.469906" maxy="43.935719"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:4326" minx="42.817253" miny="-70.953664" maxx="43.935719" maxy="-67.469906"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:3857" minx="-7898525.792100" miny="5284197.105100" maxx="-7510715.605600" maxy="5455499.906500"/>         <Style>           <Name>default</Name>           <Title>7</Title>           <LegendURL width="88" height="32">             <Format>image/png</Format>             <OnlineResource xlink:href="http://coast.noaa.gov/arcgis/services/MarineCadastre/NewHampshireMaineOceanUses/MapServer/WmsServer?request=GetLegendGraphic%26version=1.3.0%26format=image/png%26layer=7" xlink:type="simple" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" />           </LegendURL>         </Style>       </Layer>       <Layer queryable="1">         <Name>8</Name>         <Title><![CDATA[Aquaculture]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[Aquaculture includes net pens and shellfish; excludes onshore facilities linked to offshore operations.  The General Use footprint includes all areas in which the use is known to occur with some regularity, regardless of frequency or intensity.  The Dominant Use areas include areas where the use is most commonly pursued and are defined as areas within the general use footprint that are routinely used by most users most of the time.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS> <EX_GeographicBoundingBox><westBoundLongitude>-70.953664</westBoundLongitude><eastBoundLongitude>-67.469906</eastBoundLongitude><southBoundLatitude>42.817253</southBoundLatitude><northBoundLatitude>43.935719</northBoundLatitude></EX_GeographicBoundingBox> <BoundingBox CRS="CRS:84" minx="-70.953664" miny="42.817253" maxx="-67.469906" maxy="43.935719"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:4326" minx="42.817253" miny="-70.953664" maxx="43.935719" maxy="-67.469906"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:3857" minx="-7898525.792100" miny="5284197.105100" maxx="-7510715.605600" maxy="5455499.906500"/>         <Style>           <Name>default</Name>           <Title>8</Title>           <LegendURL width="88" height="32">             <Format>image/png</Format>             <OnlineResource xlink:href="http://coast.noaa.gov/arcgis/services/MarineCadastre/NewHampshireMaineOceanUses/MapServer/WmsServer?request=GetLegendGraphic%26version=1.3.0%26format=image/png%26layer=8" xlink:type="simple" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" />           </LegendURL>         </Style>       </Layer>       <Layer queryable="1">         <Name>9</Name>         <Title><![CDATA[Industrial/Military Dominant Use Summary]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[A heat map showing the number of overlapping dominant use areas for all types of industrial/military uses.  The Dominant Use areas include areas where a use is most commonly pursued and are defined as areas within the general use footprint that are routinely used by most users most of the time.  These uses include:  Aquaculture, Alternative energy, Cruise ships, Military operations, Mining and mineral extraction, Offshore oil and gas, Shipping, and Underwater cables.]]></Abstract> <CRS>CRS:84</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:4326</CRS> <CRS>EPSG:3857</CRS>  <!-- alias 3857 --> <CRS>EPSG:102100</CRS> <EX_GeographicBoundingBox><westBoundLongitude>-70.953664</westBoundLongitude><eastBoundLongitude>-67.469906</eastBoundLongitude><southBoundLatitude>42.817253</southBoundLatitude><northBoundLatitude>43.935719</northBoundLatitude></EX_GeographicBoundingBox> <BoundingBox CRS="CRS:84" minx="-70.953664" miny="42.817253" maxx="-67.469906" maxy="43.935719"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:4326" minx="42.817253" miny="-70.953664" maxx="43.935719" maxy="-67.469906"/> <BoundingBox CRS="EPSG:3857" minx="-7898525.792100" miny="5284197.105100" maxx="-7510715.605600" maxy="5455499.906500"/>         <Style>           <Name>default</Name>           <Title>9</Title>           <LegendURL width="22" height="80">             <Format>image/png</Format>             <OnlineResource xlink:href="http://coast.noaa.gov/arcgis/services/MarineCadastre/NewHampshireMaineOceanUses/MapServer/WmsServer?request=GetLegendGraphic%26version=1.3.0%26format=image/png%26layer=9" xlink:type="simple" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" />           </LegendURL>         </Style>       </Layer>       </Layer>       <Layer queryable="1">         <Title><![CDATA[Extractive/Fishing Uses]]></Title>         <Abstract><![CDATA[These layers show general use and dominant use patterns for twelve separate extractive/fishing ocean uses documented as part of the New Hampshire/Southern Main Ocean Uses Atlas project.  These uses include: Commercial dive fishing, Commercial fishing with benthic fixed gear, Commercial fishing with benthic mobile gear, Commercial kelp and algae harvest, Commercial lobster fishing, Commercial pelagic fishing, Kayak fishing, Recreational dive fishing, Recreational fishing from boats for Benthic Species, Recreational fishing from boats forPelagic Species, Shore-based Recreational Harvest, Shore-based Fishing.  The General Use footprint includes all areas in which the use is known to occur with some regularity, regardless of frequency or intensity.
